title: AP Bruisers don’t have specific itemization because AP items already offer everything they need.
body:
It is really no different than AD bruisers. Very seldom will an AD bruiser build all AD bruiser items, let me lay out the bruiser items so we can have a visual demonstration of what I mean:

{{item:3078}} (this isn’t necessarily a bruiser item but it is one many bruisers build)
{{item:3053}} 
{{item:3748}}: probably the quintessential bruiser item
{{item:3022}} 
{{item:3071}} 
{{item:3091}} let’s just throw this in there because it really has no other place
{{item:3026}} it’s arguable whether or not this is a bruiser item, i would say not but it is an item bruisers tend to build
{{item:3156}} 
{{item:3074}} we should consider this a bruiser item only because it’s appealing to melee champions only
{{item:3025}} maybe more of a tank item but bruisers do build this

What do these items have in common? They offer a combination of HP, resistances, and damage, to enhance survivability. In reality, no AD bruiser every truly builds 5 of these items. What they typically do is go two, maybe 3 of these items at most, and either go into a tanks item set to greatly enhance their durability; or they go into an AD assassin/ADC’s item set to greatly enhance their damage. The logic is that building 5 bruiser items won’t greatly enhance the stats you need most so you trickle into other stats that will give your greatest need depending on the game (do I need more damage or durability?). 

AP itemization already covers these bases because many AP items already mix in HP, resistances, and ability power in their items. And like AD bruisers, AP bruisers have the option of picking up Tank items to enhance their damage ({{item:3001}}) and durability in one. Many AP items like {{item:3027}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3151}} and a mixture of {{item:3157}} and {{item:3102}} do the same thing for AP bruisers that the AD bruiser items do for AD bruisers. Typically an AP bruiser will build 3 of these at the most (see {{champion:68}} and {{item:3116}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3157}}) and they’ll make the decision if they need to enhance damage by going items like {{item:3089}} and {{item:3135}} (but at the cost of survivability) or enhance durability and go into tank items (and sacrifice damage). The difference is that many of these AP bruisers will also have tank-like utility while also having innate defensive tools that also scale with HP/AP (shields, %damage reduction, heals, etc). The very nature of AP itemization covers the needs for the few AP bruisers that exist. The concept of AP bruiser is also both hard to define and balance because there is a fine line between an AP bruiser and a mage (again, see Rumble who could honestly be classified as both; see Ryze for a champion who could be both but obviously leans towards a mage). It’s the same as AD bruisers and AD assassins having a fine line separating them. 

There is no need to make “AP itemization more diverse.” It already is and given the nature of AP enhancing a larger variety of stats  (enhancing durability, damage and utility while AD only enhances damage and in some cases durability), AP itemization doesn’t really need to be more diverse. It does it’s job and because the philosophical approach to bruisers is a moderate damage dealer/moderate damage absorber; there’s no need to develop items to do this for AP bruiser - AP itemization already does.

Riot tried to give AP itemization good tank nuking options before and it didn't go too well. Most people weren't even aware of it either. 

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Blackfire_Torch

I don't know if you were around for the Blackfire Torch meta (on TT and Dominion, the above is just the nerfed version) but when all AP champions get tank nuking options, everyone dies before they get the chance to even retaliate. Pretty much every melee champion without %damage reduction is completely invalidated no matter how much defense they build. Couple this with how absurd physical damage gets late game and no one can survive anything, not even tanks. It's a very degenerative process where everyone just ends up rushing damage and the champions that can deal damage the most reliably are the only ones that get picked. 

Most AP champions tend to have more utility (or innate sustain) to make up for the lack of potential sustained damage. For balance purposes, it's honestly best that it stays this way.

You are so biased it hurts. You intentionally framed your argument in a way that deceptively overrates AD. In other words, AD scales only damage (AP can also scale with everything you mentioned except crit). Let’s rephrase this properly without ignoring functions of AP and AD:

AD scales damage
AD scales lifestel
AD, in some cases, can scale individual shields

Now: 

AP scales damage 
AP Scales shields - depending on the champion, these shields can be used on oneself or allies.
AP scales heals - depending on the champion, these heals can be used on oneself or an ally. 
AP, in some cases, can scale resistances/%damage reduction. 

In other words, AD is used for individual gains while AP can be used for both individual and collective gains. The natures of the stats lend themselves toward this. It is not a question of whether one is stronger than the other because they do entirely different things. Comparing them is misleading and frankly, foolish.

Why are you even talking about AP bruiser itemization? The problem isn't the lack of AP bruiser items, it's the lack of AP bruisers. We already had so few, and then Riot decides to turn Sej into something else, and Zac is a fucking abomination that has no identity now. 

{{champion:154}} was the perfect example of an AP sustain bruiser, with his highest win % being top lane, and functioning and building similar to an AP Darius. And now what is he? He isn't a bruiser, and he sure as shit isn't a tank, with no passive or active armor/res buffs, no shielding, and no damage mitigation. He's a support, who happens to jungle at a below average level, and can't be properly balanced.

Sej and Zac used to have more choices as bruisers, but they got 'streamlined' or 'normalized' or whatever the fuck they're calling it now, so that LC$ could have more cc heavy support damage sponges, and viewers could say "oh that one stuns things, and that other one kills things". The game is so dumbed down at this point, that sub classes are ignored or erased. We just have stunners and killers now, so it's nice and brain dead for the average preteen Fortnite player who still isn't playing or watching this game, regardless of the bastardizing Riot does with their reworks.

Tbh I want an actual ap item overhaul. Not the bullshit they keep doing. Give back your high ap builds and have them differeentiate that build from a 40% cdr build, which would nessecitate having a lower value of AP. So 40% cdr will come with ~40% less ap but you get a 40% increased uptime on spells. 

Cdr builds should synergize with late game DPS mages like swain, Cassio, ryze, karthus, anivia and so on. Whereas high raw damage/no cdr builds should synergize with champions who want to burst. Like lux, leblanc, Kat, and so on. 1shots should not be possible without being fed with a 40% cdr build and the choice you make should be high burst or high dps. 

There should be other changes along with it but that would go a bit towards making ap itemization feel like you have more choices instead of cookie cutter builds on all champions.

I don’t know how I feel about an AP black cleaver. I feel like the nature of AP would lend it to being heavily abused my mages, so there would need to be checks on it that would discourage mages from building it if it existed. Also, magic resist values do not tend to get as high as armor values on champions, (champions typically build more armor than MR), so I’m not sure one is really needed. AP bruisers will have pretty decent utility too, so in reality we need to ask if AP bruisers should really have %MR shred available to them when they’re already incredibly disruptive. The idea of Rumble or Vlad with an AP BC terrifies me.

I think the main problem is that MR is just far too strong which makes playing ap feel like shit in general. MR items are WAY too efficient due to differences in how armor and MR scales.
